DOCNAME: CASE OF GHIMP AND OTHERS v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Life) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Article 2-1 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE and PERSON .

CARDINAL . The present case concerns the circumstances surrounding the death of PERSON , who was the first applicant ’s husband , the second and the third applicants’ sibling and the fourth applicant ’s brother - in - law .

CARDINAL . PERSON , who was DATE at the time of the events in question and the father of CARDINAL children DATE , worked as a truck driver . On DATE at TIME he went to work in order to load his truck and prepare it for DATE . According to witnesses , he finished work at TIME After that and before going home , he spent time enjoying drinks with his co - workers , first at their workplace and later in CARDINAL bars . At TIME he left the bar and took a taxi . He subsequently had a dispute with the taxi driver because the driver had allegedly not taken him to the agreed destination . Because he refused to pay the fare , the taxi driver drove him to GPE police station . According to witnesses from the police station , the taxi driver left after a short time and after being paid by PERSON . The report of the latter ’s arrest , however , stated that he had been found drunk and sleeping at a bus station . There was no mention of the incident with the taxi driver in the report .

CARDINAL . According to the applicants , at the police station , PERSON was beaten up by QUANTITY police officers : GPE , GPE and ORG , and was left lying in the corridor on a dirty concrete floor . He was released TIME at TIME

CARDINAL . According to the accused police officers , PERSON was not beaten up at the police station and was told that he was free to go shortly after being brought in . However , being severely intoxicated he refused to leave and preferred to sleep on the floor until TIME .

CARDINAL . After being released at TIME DATE , PERSON went home . According to his wife and a person who had seen him walking home , he was pale and walking very slowly . He told his wife that he had stomach ache and spent DATE in bed . Only later during the evening , after the pain had intensified , did he tell his wife about the beating at the police station . He told her that the pain had started after a blow to his stomach which had caused him to feel a sharp pain and lose his breath . Later during the night PERSON started vomiting and his wife called an ambulance , which took him to a hospital . On DATE at CARDINAL a.m. PERSON died in hospital .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the first applicant informed ORG of PERSON ’s account of his beating at PERSON police station . On DATE criminal proceedings were initiated by ORG .

CARDINAL . An autopsy report dated DATE stated that his death had resulted from diffuse purulent peritonitis after a perforated ulcer of the small intestine . The perforated ulcer had developed after a blow with a blunt object with a small impact area , possibly on TIME DATE .

CARDINAL . In another forensic report dated DATE , a panel of forensic doctors composed of doctors GPE , GPE and GPE , after examining the victim ’s medical documents and his exhumed corpse , came to a similar conclusion , namely that he had died as a result of a rupture of the small intestine resulting in intestinal contents flowing into the abdominal cavity and causing bacterial contamination of the abdominal cavity – in other words , purulent inflammation of the peritoneum . According to the doctors , the injury causing his death had resulted from a blow from a blunt object with a small surface area to PERSON stomach , possibly on TIME DATE . The doctors did not find any traces of alcohol in his blood and concluded that he had been sober at the time of his death . They also concluded that there was a chance that his life could have been saved had he gone to a hospital within TIME after being injured .

CARDINAL . During the criminal investigation , the prosecutor in charge of the case questioned numerous witnesses , including police officers from LOC police station . The QUANTITY police officers suspected of ill - treating PERSON denied that he had been treated violently and unanimously maintained that he had been found drunk and sleeping at a bus stop and brought to the police station . They also stated that after questioning him , PERSON had refused to go home because it was late and he had no money and preferred to sleep on the floor of the police station . All the police officers submitted that PERSON had been intoxicated but that he had not presented any signs of violence or injuries .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL other police officers from GPE police station , who were not suspects , submitted that the victim had come to the police station together with a taxi driver , whom he had been refusing to pay for a fare . After TIME the taxi driver had been paid by PERSON and had left the premises of the police station . The police officers also denied having witnessed acts of violence against PERSON and also stated that he had preferred to sleep on the floor in the corridor of the police station rather than go home .

CARDINAL . A witness , ORG , who had been brought to the police station on TIME ( DATE ) , stated that she had had an argument with her family and had been taken to LOC police station from her home . At the police station she had been in the same room as a man who had had an argument with a taxi driver . She had understood that from the discussion which that man had had with QUANTITY police officers . Because he had continued to refuse to pay the taxi driver , the police officers had beaten him up in front of her . She had seen the police officers punching the man until he had collapsed to the floor . Then CARDINAL of the police officers had grabbed the man by his coat , dragged him into the corridor and left him lying on the concrete floor . She had later been released after being forced to sign a document stating that she was being fined for appearing drunk in public . As in PERSON case , the report of her arrest stated that she had been arrested on the street .

CARDINAL . The prosecutor also questioned the people with whom PERSON had spent DATE on DATE . All of them stated that he had appeared to be in good health and had not shown any signs of illness throughout DATE . The prosecutor ’s attempt to find the taxi driver who had brought PERSON to the police station was not successful .

CARDINAL . On DATE one of the accused police officers , ORG , changed his initial statement . He admitted to having lied in his previous statement and admitted that PERSON had been brought to the police station by a taxi driver . He submitted that another co - accused , police officer GPE , had punched the victim several times in the stomach area . Then GPE had taken money from the pocket of PERSON trousers and had paid the taxi driver . After that , he had punched PERSON several more times . ORG also stated that the beating had taken place in his presence and that of CARDINAL other people , a police officer and a person who had been brought to the police station that TIME and had been in the same room . ORG stated that he had decided to change his initial statement because he had felt remorseful and sorry for PERSON children and wife . His statement was given in the presence of a lawyer TIME and TIME and was videotaped . At the time of his questioning he was not detained in custody .

CARDINAL . During further questioning of the other QUANTITY police officers suspected of ill - treating PERSON , they also admitted that he had been brought by a taxi driver to the police station – not found sleeping at a bus stop as had been mentioned in the report of his arrest and as initially stated by them . They continued , however , to deny having ill - treated him .

CARDINAL . NORP The prosecutor also examined the room where questioning usually took place in the LOC police station and in which the victim had allegedly been beaten up , and discovered numerous blood stains on the walls and furniture .

CARDINAL . During the subsequent court proceedings , suspect ORG changed his statement again and submitted that nobody had ill - treated PERSON on TIME of DATE . When asked why he had admitted on DATE to CARDINAL of the co - accused having ill - treated PERSON in his presence , he replied that he could not remember having made such a statement because he had been very tired and hungry on DATE , as he had been on duty the previous night and had worked around the clock . He remembered , however , that the prosecutor had threatened him and had used a swear word in doing so and that he had not been assisted by a lawyer of his choice . He also argued that at the time of questioning he had not realised the questioning was being filmed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found police officers GPE , GPE and GPE guilty of acts of violence against PERSON causing his death . They were also found guilty of making false statements in the report of PERSON arrest and in the report of witness ORG ’s arrest and were each sentenced to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . The court also ordered them to pay compensation to the first applicant in respect of non - pecuniary damage in the amount of CARDINAL lei ( ORG ) and ruled that the rest of the claims made by her be examined in separate civil proceedings .

CARDINAL . NORP The police officers appealed against conviction . During the appeal proceedings , one of the officers , GPE , presented a new version of events , namely that PERSON had fallen down in the police station and that a table had fallen on top of him . On DATE ORG partially allowed the ORG appeals and reduced GPE ’s sentence to DATE imprisonment and that of GPE and GPE to DATE each .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed an appeal on points of law brought by the officers and , after concluding that the case had not been thoroughly examined , quashed the judgment of ORG and ordered a re - examination of the proceedings by the same court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the police officers of all charges . ORG statement of DATE was excluded on the grounds that it had been obtained in breach of the provisions of LAW , namely that it had been obtained late in TIME when PERSON had been very tired and in the absence of a lawyer of his choice . In excluding ORG statement the court relied on the statement of a psychologist , who submitted that in cases of extreme tiredness a person may be prone to making false self - incriminating statements . As to the statement of ORG , the court considered it unreliable because she had reason to resent the police officers who had arrested her on DATE . Moreover , some of the assertions she had made in her statement were considered to be contradictory . As to the findings of the panel of forensic doctors , the court held that they were refuted by the statements of CARDINAL of the experts who had signed the report dated DATE , NORP That expert had been invited to testify by CARDINAL of the accused police officers . He had changed his opinion and had stated that PERSON injuries could have been caused TIME on DATE and TIME on DATE that is prior to his detention . In accepting ORG ’s new opinion , the court did not explain why it preferred it over the conclusion of the panel of forensic doctors or what had made ORG change his opinion after DATE had passed . In so far as the charges of making false statements in the arrest reports were concerned , the court found that the accused had indeed made false statements ; however , as there was no personal gain involved , they were acquitted .
CARDINAL . On DATE a panel of ORG dismissed an appeal on points of law lodged by ORG and by the first applicant . ORG challenged this judgment with an extraordinary appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG accepted the extraordinary appeal and quashed both the judgment of ORG and that of ORG of DATE . ORG found , inter alia , that the findings of the first panel of forensic doctors could not be rebutted by the opinion of a single doctor and that only the opinion of another panel of doctors could be acceptable . A fresh re - examination of the appeal against the judgment of DATE was ordered .

CARDINAL . During the proceedings , ORG ordered a repeated forensic examination in respect of the circumstances of PERSON death by a panel of doctors from ORG . In the meantime , GPE , the expert who had testified during the previous proceedings before ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , had become the chief doctor of ORG .

CARDINAL . In an expert report dated DATE , a panel of doctors reached , on the basis of medical documents , a conclusion identical to that expressed by ORG during the previous proceedings before ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , namely that the victim ’s injury had been caused CARDINAL TIME on DATE and TIME on DATE . According to the report , the rupture of his intestine had initially been incomplete and only on DATE had it become complete , causing PERSON death .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the appeals lodged by the officers , reversed the judgment of ORG of DATE and acquitted the officers of all the charges against them . In so doing , ORG attributed substantial weight to the new forensic report of DATE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG dismissed an appeal on points of law lodged by ORG .
CARDINAL . LAW of DATE states :

“ Police officers are only entitled to use force and special fighting techniques for the purpose of ending criminal activities and for neutralising resistance to lawful demands in cases in which non - violent methods are not sufficient to discharge their obligations . ”
